title: Ticket #5507: Expose condor_drain functionality in the Python bindings
description:
CERN wants to be able to utilize the condor_drain functionality via the Python bindings (see the condor_drain man page).

Possibly make a new Python primitive: send a command name followed by a ClassAd.

Talk to ToddT or TJ for more info about Python bindings.
remarks:
The drain commands don't really fit in the claim class or in the dc_tool class, so this will be implemented in a new class. the Startd class.

This class will have two methods 

   drainJobs(drain_type, resume_on_completion, check) returns drain_id

drain_type optional, must be a member of the htcondor.DrainTypes enum: Fast, Graceful, or Quick. default: Graceful
resume_on_completion option, if true exit draining state when draining completes. default: false
check optional, an expression that must evaluate to true on all slots or the drain request will abort.
drain_id is a string ID assigned to the drain request when the drain command is accepted. Startd's prior to 8.4.6 or 8.5.4, will always return the empty string as the drain_id even though a non-empty drain id was actually assigned. 

   cancelDrainJobs(drain_id)

drain_id optional, the drain request id assigned by the prior drain command. if no drain id is given, all drain commands are cancelled.

Here's a sample script using the new drain binding. 

drain_fast_all_jobs.py 
#!/usr/bin/python

# Drain all startds

import htcondor
collector = htcondor.Collector()

addrs = set()

for startd_ad in collector.locateAll(htcondor.DaemonTypes.Startd):
    # collector will return all of the slot (machine) ads, but we really only want the
    # address.
    addr = startd_ad['myaddress']
    if addr in addrs: continue
    addrs.add(addr)

    print "Draining (Fast)", startd_ad['machine'], addr
    startd = htcondor.Startd(startd_ad)
    drain_id = startd.drainJobs(htcondor.DrainTypes.Fast, True)
    print "Drain id is", drain_id
